text: I absolutely love shooting my own
material especially if it's a small
handy capsule I'll hold it about there
and you know I'm looking directly at the
person it's a real fly-on-the-wall
approach and the camera becomes an
extension of me
people forget that there's a camera
there and they're connecting with me on
a real human level but it also helps me
to get into the heart of a story
sometimes especially where you don't
have time to set up because if
something's happening in front of me I
want to be able to capture that
immediately I travel to Mosul in
northern Iraq it was too dangerous
having too many Western journalists in
the one car I was separated from my
cameraman so I had to shoot my entire
journey myself I kneeled ahead Kim join
me on BBC World News
